result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 1:10 PM Defendant Timothy S. Oleson not in court.  Attorney Peter Michael Masana in court for Timothy S. Oleson.  Attorney Cody McConnell in court for State of Wisconsin.  Atty. has no record to make. Based on non-appearance, court authorized warrant.

1:35 PM Prosecuting attorney Gabriel David Arevalo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Timothy S. Oleson in court, in custody.  Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Advised rights to an attorney, waived to rec. offer.  DE explains he will likely be in-patient treatment through DOC re: scheduling.  State will send CSR to DE or his counsel once they have one.  File set for return date.  $250.00 signature bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  Booking today.
Return date scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Return date on October 28, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
